00009 #import "setversion.h"
00010 
00011 // the following four (well, two really..) defines can be used to
00012 // set a fractional build version which increases with each passing day...
00013 #define DAYZERO         183
00014 #define DAYNOW          [[NSCalendarDate calendarDate] dayOfYear]
00015 #define SV_VERSION      (double)((DAYNOW-DAYZERO) * 1000) / 100000
00016 #define SV_COMPILEDATE  [[[NSCalendarDate calendarDate] descriptionWithCalendarFormat:@"%Y%m%d"]\
00017                             cStringUsingEncoding:NSASCIIStringEncoding]
00018 
00019 // ofc, nothing is stopping us from just using an invariant define :)
00020 #define SV_VERSION_CONST     "0.1"
00021 #define SV_NAME_CONST        "setversion"
00022 
00023 #define strequal(a,b)   (!strcmp((a),(b)))
00024 
00025 
00026 
00027 const char * progname(void) {
00028     
00029     const char * result = __FILE__;
00030     
00031     NSString * name = [[[NSString stringWithCString:(result) 
00032                                               encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding] 
00033                            lastPathComponent] stringByDeletingPathExtension];
00034     
00035     char buf;
00036     BOOL success = [name getCString:buf 
00037                           maxLength:BUFSIZ-1 
00038                            encoding:NSUTF8StringEncoding];
00039     
00040     NSLog(@"name = %@", name);
00041     NSLog(@"success = %s", success == YES ? "YES" : "NO");
00042     NSLog(@"buf = %s", buf);
00043     
00044     if (success) {
00045         result = buf;
00046     }
00047 
00048     return result;
00049 }
00050 
00051 void printUsage(FILE * filedesc) {
00052     
00053     const char usage = "\n"
00054     ""
00055     "   setversion -- Xcode helper tool for updating property lists\n"
00056     "\n"
00057     "   Created by Andr√© Berg on 2009-07-03.\n"                   
00058     "   Copyright 2009 Berg Media. All rights reserved.\n"
00059     "\n"
00060     "   USAGE: setversion <plist> <key> <value>\n"
00061     "\n"
00062     "       Typically used for updating the version key inside Info.plist\n"
00063     "       during a 'Run Script' build phase in Xcode.\n"
00064     "\n"
00065     "       If <key> is \"\" (empty) \"CFBundleVersion\" will be used\n"
00066     "       If <value> is \"increment\", the value of <key> will be incremented by 1\n"
00067     "\n"
00068     "   OPTIONS:\n"
00069     "       -V, --version        Display version and exit\n"
00070     "\n"
00071     "       -h, --help           Display this help and exit\n"
00072     "\n"
00073     "        Note: If you want to see the plist printed to stdout before and\n"
00074     "              after manipulation, setenv \"NSDebugLevel\" to sth. greater than 0\n"
00075     "\n"
00076     "   EXAMPLES:\n"
00077     "\n"
00078     "       Increment the \"CFBundleVersion\" key from Info.plist:\n"
00079     "\n"
00080     "       setversion Info.plist \"\" \"increment\"\n"
00081     "\n"
00082     "       Note: keep in mind that you can use any Xcode specific\n"
00083     "             variables from project/build settings here."
00084     "\n"
00085     "   DISCLAIMER:\n"
00086     "\n"
00087     "       This program comes with ABSOLUTELY NO WARRANTY\n"
00088     "       USE AT YOUR OWN RISK!\n"
00089     "\n"
00090     "   LICENSE:\n"
00091     "\n"    
00092     "       Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the \"License\");\n"
00093     "       you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.\n"            
00094     "       You may obtain a copy of the License at\n"
00095     "\n"
00096     "           http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0\n"
00097     "\n"    
00098     "       Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software\n"
00099     "       distributed under the License is distributed on an \"AS IS\" BASIS,\n"
00100     "       WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.\n"
00101     "       See the License for the specific language governing permissions and\n"
00102     "       limitations under the License.\n"
00103     "\n"
00104     "\n"
00105     "   SEE ALSO:\n"
00106     "       man plist(5)\n"
00107     "\n";
00108     
00109     fprintf(filedesc, usage);
00110 }
00111 
00112 void printVersion(FILE * filedesc) {
00113     
00114     fprintf(filedesc, "%s v%s (%s)\n", SV_NAME_CONST, SV_VERSION_CONST, SV_COMPILEDATE);
00115 }
00116 
00117 int main (int argc, const char * argv[]) {
00118     
00119     NSAutoreleasePool * pool = [[NSAutoreleasePool alloc] init];
00120     NSMutableDictionary * plistDict;
00121 
00122     OSErr err = noErr;
00123     int DEBUG = DEBUG_LEVEL_PRODUCTION;
00124     
00125     @try {
00126         char * dbglevel = getenv("NSDebugLevel");
00127         if (dbglevel) {
00128             DEBUG = atoi(dbglevel);
00129         }
00130     }
00131     @catch (NSException * e) {
00132         // do nothing...
00133     }
00134     
00135     // too lazy to implement getopt() for such a simple tool :)
00136     if(argc == 2 && (strequal(argv[1], "-V") || strequal(argv[1], "--version"))) {
00137         
00138         printVersion(stdout);
00139         
00140         [pool drain];
00141         exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00142         
00143     } else if (argc == 2 && (strequal(argv[1], "-h") || strequal(argv[1], "--help") ) ) {
00144         
00145         printUsage(stdout);
00146         
00147         [pool drain];
00148         exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00149         
00150     } else if (argc == 4) {
00151         
00152         NSString * plistArg = [NSString stringWithCString:argv];
00153         NSString * keyArg = [NSString stringWithCString:argv];
00154         NSString * valueArg = [NSString stringWithCString:argv];
00155         
00156         if ([keyArg isEqualToString:@""]) {
00157             keyArg = @"CFBundleVersion";
00158         }
00159         
00160         // try to read the plist file at the user supplied path 
00161         plistDict = [NSMutableDictionary dictionaryWithContentsOfFile:plistArg];
00162         
00163         if (DEBUG) NSLog(@"plistDict before = %@", [plistDict descriptionInStringsFileFormat]);
00164         
00165         // plist file couldn't be read, so log error and give up...
00166         if(!plistDict) {
00167             err = ENOENT;
00168             fprintf(stderr, "Error: Can't read plist file at %s. %s (%d).\n", [plistArg UTF8String], strerror(err), err);
00169             [pool drain];
00170             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00171         }
00172         
00173         // if "value" is equal to "increment" then increment the old rev by 1
00174         if ([valueArg isEqualToString:@"increment"]) {
00175             
00176             NSInteger oldRev = [[plistDict valueForKey:keyArg] intValue];
00177             NSInteger newRev = oldRev + 1;
00178             
00179             [plistDict setObject:[NSNumber numberWithInt:newRev] forKey:keyArg];
00180             
00181         } else {
00182             [plistDict setObject:valueArg forKey:keyArg];
00183         }
00184         
00185         if (DEBUG) NSLog(@"plistDict after = %@", [plistDict descriptionInStringsFileFormat]);
00186         
00187         // write to plist at user supplied path
00188         if(![plistDict writeToFile:plistArg atomically:YES]){
00189             err = EIO;
00190             fprintf(stderr, "Error: Can't write plist file at %s. %s (%d)\n", [plistArg UTF8String], strerror(err), err);
00191             [pool drain];
00192             exit(EXIT_FAILURE);            
00193         }
00194                 
00195         [pool drain];
00196         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00197         
00198     } else {
00199         
00200         printUsage(stderr);
00201         
00202         [pool drain];
00203         exit(EXIT_FAILURE);
00204     }
00205 }
